ETYMOLOGY: Compound phrase formed from the preposition 'at', the numeral 'one', and the noun 'time', signifying a specific, usually historical, period.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A group of words functioning as an adverb, usually modifying the time of the action.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Formerly; in the past, often used to contrast the past situation with the present one.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 曾经；一度；在某个时候（常用于对比过去和现在的情况）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: At one time, this store was the most popular bakery in the neighborhood, but it closed down last year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 曾经，这家店是附近最受欢迎的烘焙店，但它去年关门了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A group of words functioning as an adverb, usually modifying the time of the action.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Simultaneously; all together, used especially when defining a limitation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 同时；一下子（通常用于限制一次行动的数量）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: You may only submit three items at one time for review.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 您每次只能提交三件物品进行审核。
